captions.text:
Good morning John, it's Sunday, August 3rd,
2014. And I love you. You're a good brother,

you're a good person, and I'm lucky to have
you in my life. I don't know where I'd be

without you, or who I'd be without you. You
make me a better person, you help me make

better decisions, you've been a good person
to look up to as a child and as an adult,

and you just have good values. Even thought
apparently you told a bunch of people at LeakyCon

that I have a little bit of a problem with
showering when I was 10, true. You could of

kept that one to yourself. If you're confused
with why I'm being so unironically sappy right
now, it's because today is Esther Day.

In 2010 John asked Esther Earl, a nerdfighter
who helped inspire The Fault in Our Stars,

what she would like us as a community to do
on her birthday. She said she wanted it to

be a day to celebrate the kind of love that
people have inside of families and friendships,

not romantic love. John as you put it last
year, you said, "It's a Valentine's Day for

the rest of love". Because, you know, we're
obsessed with romantic love, and I get that.

I understand. But love is so much more than
that, between parents and children and siblings

and friends. It's the kind of boring everyday
love that ties the whole world together. So

on this day, we say "I love you" to the people
who we don't normally say "I love you" to.

So, I'm asking, take some time out of your
day to do that thing. It's just, it's a good

thing to do, and if that's not enough for
you, it's what Esther wants. John, I'll see
you on Tuesday.

Good morning John, it's August 3rd, 2013,
and I love you-is it? It's 2014, yup.

CHild Cancer Fund. If you would like to donate any money to this super 
important cause please go to the following link 
http://www.gofundme.com/mc3t48 Thank you so much for your support!! ﻿

comments.author: LeonFirestrike

comments.text:
I love it that there is a celebrated day (even if it's not super common 
among humanity) to celebrate non-romantic love, for, until one is to get 
married, love between friends and family always make up the greatest 
portion. Personally, I wish I would've realized the significance of 
"Friendly" love in life, even a year ago, when I was twelve, for it has 
certainly changed my life and who I am from an extreme introvert to an 
opened introvert (which is how I came to love this channel), before which 
my life was completely non-satisfactory and uneventful, also combined with 
my fractured relationship with my family...
RIA Esther, you deserve it, in having us celebrate a day such as this and 
changing other people's lives with this concept, albeit with support and 
opposition...﻿

comments.author: Prince Of Rage

comments.text:
+Hank Green Great video! I was at sleepaway camp on Esther Day, and my 
friend Katie and I went around camp giving hugs to everyone we knew and 
explaining Esther Day to them. Later that day, in our bunk, we wrote notes 
to everyone in our bunk notes saying "Happy Esther Day! We love you" and 
signed them. We put the notes on their pillows when they weren't looking. 
One of the best feelings I've had was hearing people's reactions when they 
found them. It was really nice to love and know that you are loved back. It 
was really special for both me and Katie, as well as everyone else. I LOVE 
ESTHER DAY SO MUCH.﻿

comments.author: Nora Kent

comments.text:
This was a really tough video for me to watch.  On the day this video was 
posted, my aunt died very suddenly.  She was the glue of our family, 
probably the best and most loving person I've ever had the honor and 
blessing to know.  She would have loved this.  I'm sad that I didn't get to 
see this video until now, but it's so appropriate and wonderful, after just 
having gotten home from her funeral.  And although I'm still mourning and 
feel my life will never be as rich without her, I was able to love her and 
be loved by her.  And that is awesome.  Love you guys.﻿

comments.author: Bradley “Bard” Williams

comments.text:
I told my family that I loved them on Sunday. They thought there was 
something wrong with me. I'm glad I did it though and I'm glad that this is 
the legacy that was left by Esther. What better way to change the world 
than by starting with love. 

It is a message shared often, through Harry Potter, through Doctor Who, 
through Sherlock, supernatural and more. Through stories of everyday 
kindness and a smile. It is a message I think we need more now than ever as 
we increase awesome and decrease world suck. One that will save the world 
if we let it. 

Thank-you for reminding me of that message and giving me a reason to spread 
it. 

Now I need to punch something to get rid of this sappiness. ﻿
